name: details
description: Record that contains details based on the type of operation executed. Each operation will return its own relevant details, with the rest of the details as null

fields.name: account
fields.description: The amount of sold asset that was moved from the seller account to the buyer account, reported in terms of the sold amount

fields.name: account_muxed
fields.description: The virtual address of the account if the account is multiplexed

fields.name: account_muxed_id
fields.description: Integer representation of the virtual address of the account if the account is multiplexed.

fields.name: account_id
fields.description: The address of the account which is no longer sponsored

fields.name: amount
fields.description: Float representation of the amount of an asset sent/offered/etc

fields.name: asset
fields.description: The asset available to be claimed in the form of "asset_code:issuing_address". If the claimable balance is in XLM, it is reported as "native"

fields.name: asset_code
fields.description: The 4 or 12 character code representation of the asset on the network

fields.name: asset_issuer
fields.description: The account address of the original asset issuer that created the asset

fields.name: asset_id
fields.description: The identifier of the asset involved in the operation. This field provides details about the specific asset being operated on, such as in payment or transfer operations.

fields.name: asset_type
fields.description: The identifier for type of asset code, can be a alphanumeric with 4 characters, 12 characters or the native asset to the network, XLM.

fields.name: authorize
fields.description: Indicates whether the trustline is authorized. 0 is if the account is not authorized to transact with the asset in any way. 1 if the account is authorized to transact with the asset. 2 if the account is authorized to maintain orders, but not to perform other transactions.

fields.name: balance_id
fields.description: The balance id of the claimable balance which is claimed or no longer sponsored

fields.name: buying_asset_code
fields.description: The 4 or 12 character code representation of the asset that is either bought or offered to buy in a trade

fields.name: buying_asset_issuer
fields.description: The account address of the original asset issuer that created the asset bought or offered to buy

fields.name: buying_asset_id
fields.description: The identifier of the asset being bought in the operation. This is relevant for trade and offer operations, where one asset is exchanged for another.

fields.name: buying_asset_type
fields.description: The identifier for type of asset code, can be a alphanumeric with 4 characters, 12 characters or the native asset to the network, XLM.

fields.name: claimable_balance_id
fields.description: The balance id of the claimable balance which is no longer sponsored

fields.name: claimant
fields.description: The account address of the account which claimed the claimable balance

fields.name: claimant_muxed
fields.description: If the account is multiplexed, the virtual address of the account which claimed the claimable balance

fields.name: claimant_muxed_id
fields.description: If the account is multiplexed, an integer representation of the muxed account which claimed the balance

fields.name: claimants
fields.description: An unstructured field that lists account addresses eligible to claim a balance and the conditions which must be satisfied to claim the balance (typically time bound conditions)

fields.name: data_account_id
fields.description: The account address of the account whose data entry is no longer sponsored

fields.name: data_name
fields.description: The name of the data entry which is no longer sponsored

fields.name: from
fields.description: The account address from which the payment/contract originates (the sender account)

fields.name: from_muxed
fields.description: If the account is multiplexed, the virtual address of the sender account

fields.name: from_muxed_id
fields.description: If the account is multiplexed, the integer representation of the virtual address of the sender account

fields.name: funder
fields.description: When a new account is created, an account address "funds" the new account

fields.name: funder_muxed
fields.description: If the account is multiplexed, the virtual address of the account funding the new account

fields.name: funder_muxed_id
fields.description: If the account is multiplexed, the integer representation of the account funding the new account

fields.name: high_threshold
fields.description: The sum of the weight of all signatures that sign a transaction for the high threshold operation. The weight must exceed the set threshold for the operation to succeed.

fields.name: home_domain
fields.description: The home domain used for the stellar.toml file discovery

fields.name: inflation_dest
fields.description: The account address specifying where to send inflation funds. The concept of inflation on the network has been discontinued

fields.name: into
fields.description: The account address receiving the deleted account's lumens. This is the account in which the intended deleted account will be merged

fields.name: into_muxed
fields.description: If the account is multiplexed, the virtual address of the account receive the deleted account's lumens

fields.name: into_muxed_id
fields.description: If the account is multiplexed, the integer representation of the account receiving the deleted account's lumens

fields.name: limit
fields.description: The upper bound amount of an asset that an account can hold

fields.name: low_threshold
fields.description: The sum of the weight of all signatures that sign a transaction for the low threshold operation. The weight must exceed the set threshold for the operation to succeed.

fields.name: master_key_weight
fields.description: An accounts private key is called the master key. For signing transactions, the account holder can specify a weight for the master key, which contributes to thresholds validation when processing a transaction.

fields.name: med_threshold
fields.description: The sum of the weight of all signatures that sign a transaction for the medium threshold operation. The weight must exceed the set threshold for the operation to succeed.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The manage data operation allows an account to write and store data directly on the ledger in a key value pair format. The name is the key for a data entry.

fields.name: offer_id
fields.description: The unique id for the offer. This id can be joined with the 'offers' table

fields.name: path
fields.description: Path payments maximize the best exchange rate path when sending money from one asset to another asset.The intermediary assets that this path hops through will be reported in the record. This feature is especially useful when the market between the original asset pair is illiquid.

fields.name: price
fields.description: The ratio of selling asset to buying asset. This is a number representing how many units of a selling asset it takes to get 1 unit of a buying asset.

fields.name: price_r
fields.description: Precise representation of the buy and sell price of the assets on an offer. The n is the numerator, the d is the denominator. By calculating the ratio of n/d you can calculate the price of the bid or ask

fields.name: selling_asset_code
fields.description: The 4 or 12 character code representation of the asset that is either sold or offered to sell in a trade

fields.name: selling_asset_issuer
fields.description: The account address of the original asset issuer that created the asset sold or offered to sell

fields.name: selling_asset_id
fields.description: The identifier of the asset being sold in the operation. This field is used in trade and offer operations, where one asset is exchanged for another.

fields.name: selling_asset_type
fields.description: The identifier for type of asset code, can be a alphanumeric with 4 characters, 12 characters or the native asset to the network, XLM.

fields.name: set_flags
fields.description: Array of numeric values of the flags set for a given trustline in the operation

fields.name: set_flags_s
fields.description: Array of string values of the flags set for a given trustline in the operation

fields.name: signer_account_id
fields.description: The address of the account of the signer no longer sponsored

fields.name: signer_key
fields.description: The address of the signer which is no longer sponsored

fields.name: signer_weight
fields.description: The weight of the new signer. For transactions, multiple accounts can sign a transaction from a source account. This weight contributes towards calculating whether the transaction exceeds the specified threshold weight to complete the transaction

fields.name: source_amount
fields.description: The originating amount sent designated in the source asset

fields.name: source_asset_code
fields.description: The 4 or 12 character code representation of the asset that is originally sent

fields.name: source_asset_issuer
fields.description: The account address of the original asset issuer that created the asset sent

fields.name: source_asset_id
fields.description: The identifier of the source asset in the operation. This is used in payment operations where an asset is transferred or converted from one form to another.

fields.name: source_asset_type
fields.description: The identifier for type of asset code, can be a alphanumeric with 4 characters, 12 characters or the native asset to the network, XLM.

fields.name: source_max
fields.description: The maxium amount to be sent, designated in the source asset

fields.name: starting_balance
fields.description: The amount of XLM to send to the newly created account.

fields.name: to
fields.description: The address of the account receiving the payment funds

fields.name: to_muxed
fields.description: If the account is multiplexed, the virtual address of the account receiving the payment

fields.name: to_muxed_id
fields.description: If the account is multiplexed, the integer representation of the virtual address of the recipient account

fields.name: trustee
fields.description: The issuing account address (only present for 'credit' asset types)

fields.name: trustee_muxed
fields.description: If the issuing account address is multiplexed, the virtual address

fields.name: trustee_muxed_id
fields.description: If the issuing account address is multiplexed, the integer representation of the virtual address

fields.name: trustline_account_id
fields.description: The address of the account whose trustline is no longer sponsored

fields.name: trustline_asset
fields.description: The asset of the trustline which is no longer sponsored

fields.name: trustor
fields.description: The trusting account address, or the account being authorized or unauthorized

fields.name: trustor_muxed
fields.description: If the trusting account is multiplexed, the virtual address of the account

fields.name: trustor_muxed_id
fields.description: If the trusting account is multiplexed, the integer representation of the virtual address

fields.name: value
fields.description: The manage data operation allows an account to write and store data directly on the ledger in a key value pair format. The value is the value of a key for a data entry.

fields.name: clear_flags
fields.description: Array of numeric values of the flags cleared for a given trustline in the operation. If the flag was originally set, this will delete the flag

fields.name: clear_flags_s
fields.description: Array of string values of the flags cleared for a given trustline in the operation. If the flag was originally set, this will delete the flag

fields.name: destination_min
fields.description: The minimum amount to be received, designated in the expected destination asset

fields.name: bump_to
fields.description: The new desired value of the source account's sequence number

fields.name: authorize_to_maintain_liabilities
fields.description: Indicates whether the trustline is authorized. 0 is if the account is not authorized to transact with the asset in any way. 1 if the account is authorized to transact with the asset. 2 if the account is authorized to maintain orders, but not to perform other transactions.

fields.name: clawback_enabled
fields.description: Indicates whether the asset can be clawed back by the asset issuer

fields.name: sponsor
fields.description: The account address of another account that maintains the minimum balance in XLM for the source account to complete operations

fields.name: sponsored_id
fields.description: The account address of the account which will be sponsored

fields.name: begin_sponsor
fields.description: The account address of the account which initiated the sponsorship

fields.name: begin_sponsor_muxed
fields.description: If the initiating sponsorship account is multiplexed, the virtual address

fields.name: begin_sponsor_muxed_id
fields.description: If the initiating sponsorship account is multiplexed, the integer representation of the virtual address

fields.name: liquidity_pool_id
fields.description: Unique identifier for a liquidity pool

fields.name: reserve_a_asset_type
fields.description: The identifier for type of asset code, can be a alphanumeric with 4 characters, 12 characters or the native asset to the network, XLM.

fields.name: reserve_a_asset_code
fields.description: The 4 or 12 character code representation of the asset of one of the two asset pairs in a liquidity pool

fields.name: reserve_a_asset_issuer
fields.description: The account address of the original asset issuer that created one of the two asset pairs in the liquidity pool

fields.name: reserve_a_asset_id
fields.description: The identifier of the first reserve asset in a liquidity pool or similar construct. This field is relevant for operations involving liquidity pools, where multiple assets are pooled together.

fields.name: reserve_a_max_amount
fields.description: The maximum amount of reserve a that can be deposited into the pool.

fields.name: reserve_a_deposit_amount
fields.description: The amount of reserve a that ended up actually deposited into the pool

fields.name: reserve_b_asset_type
fields.description: The identifier for type of asset code, can be a alphanumeric with 4 characters, 12 characters or the native asset to the network, XLM.

fields.name: reserve_b_asset_code
fields.description: The 4 or 12 character code representation of the asset of one of the two asset pairs in a liquidity pool.

fields.name: reserve_b_asset_issuer
fields.description: The account address of the original asset issuer that created one of the two asset pairs in the liquidity pool.

fields.name: reserve_b_asset_id
fields.description: The identifier of the second reserve asset in a liquidity pool or similar construct. This field complements `details.reserve_a_asset_id` in describing the assets involved in a liquidity pool.

fields.name: reserve_b_max_amount
fields.description: The maximum amount of reserve b that can be deposited into the pool.

fields.name: reserve_b_deposit_amount
fields.description: The amount of reserve b that ended up actually deposited into the pool.

fields.name: min_price
fields.description: The floating point value indicating the minimum exchange rate for this deposit operation. Reported as Reserve A / Reserve B.

fields.name: min_price_r
fields.description: A fractional representation of the prices of the two assets in a pool. The n is the numerator (value of asset a) and the d is the denominator (value of asset b).

fields.name: max_price
fields.description: The floating point value indicating the maximum exchange rate for this deposit operation. Reported as Reserve A / Reserve B.

fields.name: max_price_r
fields.description: A fractional representation of the prices of the two assets in a pool. The n is the numerator (value of asset a) and the d is the denominator (value of asset b).

fields.name: shares_received
fields.description: A floating point number representing the number of pool shares received for this deposit. A pool share is a compilation of both asset a and asset b reserves. It is not possible to own only asset a or asset b in a pool.

fields.name: reserve_a_min_amount
fields.description: The minimum amount of reserve a that can be withdrawn from the pool.

fields.name: reserve_a_withdraw_amount
fields.description: The amount of reserve a that ended up actually withdrawn from the pool.

fields.name: reserve_b_min_amount
fields.description: The minimum amount of reserve b that can be withdrawn from the pool.

fields.name: reserve_b_withdraw_amount
fields.description: The amount of reserve b that ended up actually withdrawn from the pool.

fields.name: shares
fields.description: The number of shares withdrawn from the pool. It is not possible to withdraw only asset a or asset b, equal value must be withdrawn from the pool.

fields.name: asset_balance_changes
fields.description: Soroban field - asset balance changes from invoke host function

fields.name: parameters
fields.description: Soroban field - parameters from contract function call

fields.name: function
fields.description: Soroban field - invoke_host_function function type

fields.name: address
fields.description: Soroban field - address used to create the Soroban contract

fields.name: type
fields.description: Soroban field - type of soroban operation

fields.name: extend_to
fields.description: Soroban field - ledger extended to

fields.name: contract_id
fields.description: Soroban contract id

fields.name: contract_code_hash
fields.description: Soroban contract code hash

fields.name: ledger_key_hash
fields.description: Hash of the ledgerKey which is a subset of the ledgerEntry. The subset of ledgerEntry fields depends on ledgerEntryType.

fields.name: ledgers_to_expire
fields.description: The number of ledgers after which the operation will expire if its not executed.

name: source_account
description: The account address that originates the operation

name: source_account_muxed
description: If an account is multiplexed (muxed), the virtual account address that originates the operation

name: transaction_id
description: The transaction identifier in which the operation executed. There can be up to 100 operations in a given transaction

name: type
description: The identifier for type of asset, can be an alphanumeric with 4 characters, 12 characters or the native asset to the network, XLM.

name: type_string
description: The type of operation this operation executes

name: batch_id
description: String representation of the run id for a given DAG in Airflow. Takes the form of "scheduled__<batch_end_date>-<dag_alias>". Batch ids are unique to the batch and help with monitoring and rerun capabilities

name: batch_run_date
description: The start date for the batch interval. When taken with the date in the batch_id, the date represents the interval of ledgers processed. The batch run date can be seen as a proxy of closed_at for a ledger.

name: batch_insert_ts
description: The timestamp in UTC when a batch of records was inserted into the database. This field can help identify if a batch executed in real time or as part of a backfill. The timestamp should not be used during ad hoc analysis and is useful for data engineering purposes.

name: closed_at
description: Timestamp in UTC when this ledger closed and committed to the network. Ledgers are expected to close ~every 5 seconds

name: ledger_sequence
description: The sequence number of this ledger. It represents the order of the ledger within the Stellar blockchain. Each ledger has a unique sequence number that increments with every new ledger, ensuring that ledgers are processed in the correct order.

name: details_json
description: Record that contains details based on the type of operation executed. Each operation will return its own relevant details, with the rest of the details as null
